Name: When the Night Knocks
QuestDesc:
A mysterious request, a lost delivery, an opening door...

In a realm where dreams and nightmares intertwine, a massive shadow looms around you. It casts a darkness over reality, opening the doors to dreams across Jinzhou. It asks you, if beauty is fleeting and salvation is futile, why not remain in a dream...

Chapters.Title: Go investigate in the Whining Aix's Mire

Dialogues.Speaker: Cultured Exile
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Three days ago, the delivery van reached Waving Battlefield near Whining Aix's Mire!

Dialogues.Speaker: Cultured Exile
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Journeying from the New Federation to Jinzhou, it braved countless trials to arrive at its destination, but alas...

Dialogues.Speaker: Tianhu
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Enough. Explain it in five words.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cultured Exile
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Suspicious! Courier escaped! Package lost!

Dialogues.Speaker: Tianhu
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You're the one who's in charge of this.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cultured Exile
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Y-yes, but Boss...

Dialogues.Speaker: Tianhu
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Whatever you do, do it right and do it clean. That's the Cruising Drake's principle. Finish what you started.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cultured Exile
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah, Lollo Logistics! How despicable! Utterly insufferable!

Dialogues.Speaker: Cultured Exile
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I shall reclaim the package myself, that much is clear!

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Exile grunts and storms toward the delivery station.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You unexpectedly overhear two Exiles discussing a lost package during transit, with one of them intent on confronting Lollo Logistics about it.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (He better not be stirring up any trouble.)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (No time to call the Patrollers. Let's see what he's up to.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Cultured Exile
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I've already explained what happened, just give me the package.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cultured Exile
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If you can't, I'll... I'll file a complaint with your manager!

Dialogues.Speaker: Courier
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Don't worry, Lollo Logistics always takes care of its customers. We'll definitely get back to you within three business days.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cultured Exile
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Three days!? What if it's broken or lost? Don't you know how serious—

Dialogues.Speaker: Courier
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, if it's broken or lost, you can get a full refund. Plus, the shipping insurance you have covers it. So really, there's nothing to worry about!

Dialogues.Speaker: Cultured Exile
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...If you say so. Come to think of it, Lollo Logistics has never missed a delivery... In that case, I'll come back later.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Exile stresses the package's importance, and after a member of Lollo Logistics assures them it will be retrieved, he leaves in reluctance.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Upon arriving at Lollo Logistics, you notice the Exile departing after receiving the promise that his package will be retrieved.

Dialogues.Speaker: Courier
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ahem! We promise, we deliver! Lollo Logistics is at your service! Is there anything I can help you... you with?

Dialogues.Speaker: Courier
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, I know you! You're the Rover! A household name in Jinzhou!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lumi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hiya! I'm Lumi, the logistics team's good ol' captain. I head up the delivery team.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lumi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Do you have a package to send, or do you need something else?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lumi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, he's a regular customer. He might seem unfriendly, but he follows the rules.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lumi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: His package got lost in Whining Aix's Mire. Speaking of that place, something strange is going on there lately, so be careful when you're there, hmm?

Options.PlotLineKey: Tell me about it. Maybe I can help.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lumi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's a bit complicated... The lost package is labeled as "high value." My team member Fulei was supposed to deliver it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lumi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: He mentioned seeing weird things in Whining Aix's Mire, kinda like the stuff happening over in Tacet Fields.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lumi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I checked it out later and asked around in the port.

Options.PlotLineKey: You do act like a leader.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lumi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Of course! My team's safety is my top priority!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lumi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I didn't notice anything unusual lookin' around, but...

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But what?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lumi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm not sure if it's related... but ever since I've returned from the Whining Aix's Mire, I haven't had any dreams.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lumi's Terminal
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We promise, we deliver! We promise, we deliver!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lumi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah, it's my coworker. Sorry, I need to take this call.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lumi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes? What? She's back at work already? But she's injured! ...Okay, please take care of her. Thanks.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lumi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's one of my team members. She crashed while delivering an express package.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lumi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The doctor told her to rest, but she's already back to work...

Dialogues.Speaker: Lumi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmph... I need to bring her back. She can't be pushin' herself like this.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lumi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I was planning to search Whining Aix's Mire again, but now...

Dialogues.Speaker: Lumi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If you happen to be going in that direction, could you keep an eye out for that lost package?

Options.PlotLineKey: As long as I get paid.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lumi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Amazing! Thank you so much!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lumi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No problem. I'll make sure you're well rewarded!

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You engage in conversation with the Lollo member, named Lumi, who reveals that strange events have been occurring in the Whining Aix's Mire, where her team member lost the package. She asks for your help in recovering it, and to investigate the anomalies, you agree to assist her.

Dialogues.Speaker: Impetuous Dockworker
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Unusual? Huh? What are you talking about?

Dialogues.Speaker: Impetuous Dockworker
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, I know... Someone's deliberately spreading rumors!

Dialogues.Speaker: Impetuous Dockworker
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Port business is booming right now. They want to oust the competition to grab a slice of the pie. That's their game plan!

Dialogues.Speaker: Impetuous Dockworker
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Those rascals must be trying to scare people off to hog all the profits! No chance! This cheap trick won't work on me...

Dialogues.Speaker: Nervous Dockworker
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Waving Battlefield? I was there a week ago... on break... Ahem, can't let my boss know this.

Dialogues.Speaker: Nervous Dockworker
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Anyway, I haven't had any dreams ever since then! It's so weird!

Dialogues.Speaker: Nervous Dockworker
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I heard that some researchers screwed up an experiment there. Some even died in an accident... Wait, don't tell me I'm being haunted by their ghosts!

Dialogues.Speaker: Nervous Dockworker
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh no, kind ghosts, have mercy on me!

Dialogues.Speaker: Calm Dockworker
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm, now that you mention it, I haven't had any dreams this week.

Dialogues.Speaker: Calm Dockworker
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I used to have nightmares about the day my father left. He was devoured by a Tacet Field and never returned.

Dialogues.Speaker: Calm Dockworker
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But since the dreams stopped, I've been sleeping better than ever.

Dialogues.Speaker: Calm Dockworker
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Maybe it's my father who's been driving them away... Heh, maybe it's a blessing in disguise?

Chapters.Title: Investigate the depths of Waving Battlefield
Investigate the depths of Waving Battlefield

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What happened here?

Chapters.Title: Investigate the depths of Waving Battlefield

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Somnoire gateway must be just ahead...

Chapters.Title: Investigate the depths of Waving Battlefield

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But why is it closed?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That white cat... Why are the Tacet Discords after it?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'll handle them first.

Dialogues.Speaker: Strange White Cat
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Meow—

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Feels like I'm floating... Is the cat helping me?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This should be the last one.

Dialogues.Speaker: Strange White Cat
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Meow—

Dialogues.Speaker: Strange White Cat
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Meow... meow...

Options.PlotLineKey: You want me to go inside?

Dialogues.Speaker: Strange White Cat
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Meow!

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In the Whining Aix's Mire, you encounter a white cat that escaped the Somnoire by train. It asks you to enter a mysterious gateway...

Chapters.Title: Complete Dreamscape Odyssey: Against All Odds

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Nobody's here, just this cat. What's going on...
Just know that even the great Rover cannot stop me now!

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
A moon with an ethereal brightness, a pond glimmering beneath the night sky, and a massive shadow lurking in the darkness...

In an instant, it feels as if every memory has slipped away, like a fleeting nightmare.

You sense that you've traveled back to the moment you first stepped through the gateway.

Dialogues.Speaker: Illusia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's you... you've returned.

Dialogues.Speaker: Illusia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Here, countless dreams rush in...

Dialogues.Speaker: Illusia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: These dreams... I no longer wish to have them, to remember anything.

Dialogues.Speaker: Illusia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But I do remember things about you...

Dialogues.Speaker: Illusia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You're the only one who can restore everything to its rightful place. That's what he said to me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Illusia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Farewell, Dreamwalker. May your thoughts remain unclouded.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What is this? I've never seen this in the Somnoire before.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I should look around for more information.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (This is... a delivery checklist. The name signed here is "Fulei.")

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (The rest is smudged. Someone must have lost it here.)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Some kind of fragment lodged between those rocks. Something from a delivery crate?)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (This is probably where Fulei lost the package, but where is it now...)

Chapters.Title: Talk to the strange white cat

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Is that... Lumi? The Tacet Discords are after her!)

Chapters.Title: Defeat the enemies standing in your way
Talk to the strange white cat

Dialogues.Speaker: Lumi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Find the missing package...

Dialogues.Speaker: Lumi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Make sure she gets back safely... help with the express order...

Dialogues.Speaker: Lumi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Organize a welcome party for the new recruits...

Dialogues.Speaker: Lumi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Work finished... Best get movin'. Too many tasks, too little time.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In the dream, you come across Lumi, but it appears she can't hear you.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Why can't she hear me?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No, she's in danger！

Chapters.Title: Defeat the enemies standing in your way
Talk to the strange white cat

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Earlier, over on Lumi's side...

Dialogues.Speaker: Lumi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Fulei said the package was lost nearby... Hmm, where is it?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lumi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh! It's his delivery checklist!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lumi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The paper's all smudged, can't read a thing...

Dialogues.Speaker: Lumi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This fragment is from the delivery container... Ugh, where's the package? What if it's been damaged...

Dialogues.Speaker: Lumi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Where could it be? Hopefully, I'll find a clue ahead.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lumi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Nothing here...

Dialogues.Speaker: Lumi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah! Where did those Tacet Discords come from?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lumi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Can't waste my time with them...

Dialogues.Speaker: Lumi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Phew... made it out at last. But why did those monsters stop chasing me?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lumi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ugh, I keep getting sidetracked. Focus, Lumi! Think about what you're gonna do next.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lumi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: First, find the missing package...

Dialogues.Speaker: Lumi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Second, make sure Tangtang gets back safely and help with the express order...

Dialogues.Speaker: Lumi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Third, organize a welcome party for the new recruits... get my own work finished...

Dialogues.Speaker: Lumi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Best get movin'. Too many tasks, too little time.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lumi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm their leader. Got to act the part. They're counting on me...

Chapters.Title: Talk to the strange white cat

Dialogues.Speaker: Strange White Cat
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Meow—

Dialogues.Speaker: Lumi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This must be where Tangtang crashed... I need to find her first, Fulei's package can wait.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lumi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Why are there Tacet Discords here? Where is Tangtang? Is she...

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Lumi! Thank goodness you're safe!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lumi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}!!!

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let's deal with it first and go find Tangtang.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lumi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let's do it!!!

Chapters.Title: Go look for Tangtang with Rover

Dialogues.Speaker: Lumi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Phew, finally... {PlayerName}, let's go find Tangtang!

Dialogues.Speaker: Tangtang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You're here, Lumi! I've been looking for you!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lumi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Looking for me? I should be the one saying that. I heard you had an accident...

Dialogues.Speaker: Tangtang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A small scratch, no biggie.

Dialogues.Speaker: Tangtang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I was worried you might run into a Tacet Discord, so I came looking for you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lumi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thanks, I'm fine. Let me help you with the delivery.

Dialogues.Speaker: Tangtang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's okay. The address is around here somewhere. It won't take long.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lumi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But you're hurt. You relax and let me handle it, alright?

Dialogues.Speaker: Tangtang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I can manage, really. You have your own tasks to do. I can even help you later when I'm done!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lumi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's my job to look out for you... That's what a team leader should do.

Dialogues.Speaker: Tangtang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I know, and you've been doing great. I just want to lighten the load.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lumi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Aww, Tangtang...

Dialogues.Speaker: Tangtang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Don't worry! I'll catch up with you after I finish this order!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lumi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Okay!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lumi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you, Tangtang. I mean it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lumi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And you, Rover...

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Against all odds, you and Lumi finally find Tangtang, her injured teammate, who had been searching for Lumi as well. Lumi is deeply moved, realizing for the first time that her value isn’t just in what she gives to others—her team members genuinely want to support her in return.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lumi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, hi! You're here!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lumi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: D'ya know what, I had a dream just now! And guess what? You were in it!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lumi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My team members were asking for help, but I couldn't get to them.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lumi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I kept getting blocked or showing up too late.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lumi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I was so worried, thinking they might be disappointed or not need me anymore.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lumi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But later, I managed to find a girl who'd got into an accident.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lumi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I don't know how, but I felt like you were guiding me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lumi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Talking with her made me see how important it is to support each other.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lumi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I help my team, and they help me right back.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lumi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I think that's where I found the strength to escape that nightmare.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lumi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I wouldn't have realized this without your help. Thank you so much, {PlayerName}.

Chapters.Title: Talk to the white cat in the carriage

Dialogues.Speaker: Strange White Cat
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thanks a lot...

Dialogues.Speaker: Strange White Cat
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Only a bit...

Dialogues.Speaker: Strange White Cat
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Somnoire breaks into world. My authority... lost.

Dialogues.Speaker: Strange White Cat
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Many places... gateway open. Enter and fight!

Options.PlotLineKey: I see now. I can help.
I saw Lumi. Is she okay?

Dialogues.Speaker: Strange White Cat
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A sharp mind. You are smart.

Dialogues.Speaker: Strange White Cat
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You saw Illusia, not real Lumi. She is safe, don't worry...

Dialogues.Speaker: Strange White Cat
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No energy left. Can't talk. Stop disaster. I trust you...

Dialogues.Speaker: Strange White Cat
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Meow—

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: After aiding Lumi in resolving her issues, you discover that the white cat can now speak. It explains that gateways have emerged across various regions, and it has lost its control over the Somnoire. It requests you to help reclaim its clearance.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Lumi hasn't had any dreams since visiting Whining Aix's Mire.)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (And the Illusia I just saw of her... This abnormal Somnoire seems to be trapping parts of people's consciousness in their dreams.)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (If this has been going on for a while, Lumi might not be the only one trapped here.)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (She dreams about her team, but what about the others? I need to find more clues.)

Chapters.Title: Complete Dreamscape Odyssey: The Mountain and Six Credits

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You feel your body grow heavy, as if you're sinking beneath the water, and finally find yourself in an unfamiliar dream.

Dialogues.Speaker: Art Manager
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Master Zhezhi, have you made any plans for your next painting?

Dialogues.Speaker: Art Manager
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If you don't paint, you can't earn! You don't wanna end up broke, do ya?

Dialogues.Speaker: Art Manager
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What about painting... what was it called? Ah, Winter's Serenade in Bloom?

Options.PlotLineKey: I-I want to try something different.

Dialogues.Speaker: Art Manager
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So what? Your clients' preferences are what matter most.

Dialogues.Speaker: Art Manager
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Don't worry, Master Zhezhi! I handpicked your clients and know them like the back of my hand.

Dialogues.Speaker: Art Manager
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That painting was outstandingly popular, I would know.

Dialogues.Speaker: Art Manager
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Trust me. This will be another best-seller!

Dialogues.Speaker: Art Manager
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Of course. Take your time, Master Zhezhi. Let me know when you've decided.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A manager asks Zhezhi to focus solely on producing more copies of her renowned painting Winter's Serenade in Bloom, but Zhezhi seems determined to follow her own path.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ha... I need a walk now. Maybe I'll find some new inspiration.

Chapters.Title: Find a good viewpoint to design your composition

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This place...

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's all so beautiful... I have to capture it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let me find the perfect spot to stop and paint.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The landscape looks great from this side. It's perfect for planning my painting.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Waters and mountains rest by the pane, valleys and peaks in the dream remain...

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The composition looks fine, but something's still missing...

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Maybe I should get closer to see the tiny details of the trees and rocks.

Chapters.Title: Talk to the strange white cat

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That place should be close enough.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Waterlamp, Dewvetch, Pearl Leaf, and Bittberry...

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: These vibrant plants harmonize exquisitely with the cold stones.

Chapters.Title: Showcase Tacet Discords in your painting

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Didn't expect to see Tacet Discords like that here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm... They do complete the scene I had in mind.

Chapters.Title: Showcase Tacet Discords in your painting
Return to speak with your manager

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The details of the stones and trees... I got it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I can show this draft to my manager.

Dialogues.Speaker: Art Manager
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Master Zhezhi!

Dialogues.Speaker: Art Manager
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Okay, Master Zhezhi! About the painting I mentioned last time...

Dialogues.Speaker: Art Manager
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Very well! Let's see!

Dialogues.Speaker: Art Manager
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What? What's this?

Dialogues.Speaker: Art Manager
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Zhezhi, you're a true master! Would a master present a client with a half-finished piece?

Dialogues.Speaker: Art Manager
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Your last painting sold for the highest price at auction! Give the people what they want, that's what I always say.

Dialogues.Speaker: Art Manager
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You just need to paint it again, and I'll make sure it sells well.

Dialogues.Speaker: Art Manager
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: With all due respect, Master Zhezhi, not everyone will buy whatever you paint.

Dialogues.Speaker: Art Manager
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I've worked so hard to find a few clients who love your style. How can I sell your paintings if you can't cater to their needs?

Dialogues.Speaker: Art Manager
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Please focus on recre—I mean, creating tonight! I won't disturb you. I'll come and pick it up tomorrow.

Dialogues.Speaker: Art Manager
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No more indulging your every creative whim. All I'm asking for is another Winter's Serenade in Bloom. I'm counting on you, Master Zhezhi!

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Zhezhi presents her latest work to the manager, but he insists that she should only replicate her earlier piece, which has already garnered widespread acclaim.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Zhezhi quickly completes yet another copy of the Winter's Serenade in Bloom. However, her manager soon requests another one.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I have to make another copy...

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Zhezhi loses track of how many times she recreates the same painting, the stack of scrolls growing ever taller.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Perhaps I'm nothing more than a tool for copying paintings.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In their eyes... am I only capable of copying my old work?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Can I really call myself an artist then?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Zhezhi.

Chapters.Title: Stop the nightmares from corrupting Zhezhi
Stop the nightmares from corrupting Zhezhi

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What do you really want to paint?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Do you remember when you painted the first Winter's Serenade in Bloom?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes. I saw flowers blooming in the middle of winter, and birds were circling around...

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You worked really hard on it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And... that hard work should be noticed.

Chapters.Title: Stop the nightmares from corrupting Zhezhi
Stop the nightmares from corrupting Zhezhi

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Believe in your judgment, your brush, and yourself.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Believe in... myself.

Chapters.Title: Activate Dream Link and defeat the nightmares together

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Zhezhi musters her courage and continues to work on the unfinished draft.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Waters and mountains rest by the pane, valleys and peaks in the dream remain. Colors of vanity washed away, the painted world fades, forgotten today...

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This giant bird... It's... it's the one from Winter's Serenade in Bloom!

Dialogues.Speaker: Art Manager
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I keep telling you, your clients only want that one painting!

Dialogues.Speaker: Art Manager
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Don't be so stubborn, Zhezhi! A painting that doesn't sell well is meaningless!

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm the artist, not just the brush.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's the soul I put into my paintings that makes people appreciate them!

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you, {PlayerName}...

Chapters.Title: Talk to the white cat in the carriage

Dialogues.Speaker: Strange White Cat
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Nice job, purr-fect!

Dialogues.Speaker: Strange White Cat
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Dreams cleansed! Power restored! I can talk now.

Dialogues.Speaker: Strange White Cat
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Somnoire is growing faster... If this keeps up, Solaris will be in danger.

Dialogues.Speaker: Strange White Cat
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Walk through more gateways. Save people from dreams. Fight that person. I'm counting on you!

Dialogues.Speaker: Strange White Cat
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Talking drains my energy. Need to rest now...

Dialogues.Speaker: Strange White Cat
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Meow—

Dialogues.Speaker: Strange White Cat
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Meow...

Dialogues.Speaker: Strange White Cat
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Meow—

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (From the looks of it, I'm probably the only one who can enter the Somnoire as I please...)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Besides that cat, the only other people here are the ones trapped in their dreams.)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (I will be the one to help them escape.)

Chapters.Title: Complete Dreamscape Odyssey: Little Warrior's Stage
Open the present and talk to Cloudy

Dialogues.Speaker: Encore
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A long, long time ago, there was a brave warrior in the Magical Kingdom. Her name was Encore.

Dialogues.Speaker: Encore
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: One day, she met her good friend, Cloudy.

Dialogues.Speaker: Encore
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Come on, Cloudy!

Dialogues.Speaker: Encore
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Cloudy said she was a princess from a wonderful play. Everyone loved her performance.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cloudy
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Baa!

Dialogues.Speaker: Encore
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But then, out of nowhere... a Big Bad Demon appeared!

Chapters.Title: Defeat the monsters sent by the Big Bad Demon

Dialogues.Speaker: Encore
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Big Bad Demon sent its minions to attack the Magical Kingdom.

Dialogues.Speaker: Encore
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Everyone hid at home, and the stage was empty and quiet.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cloudy
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Baa...

Dialogues.Speaker: Encore
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But then, Warrior Encore stood up and said she would fight the Big Bad Demon!

Dialogues.Speaker: Encore
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: To bring the crowd back, Cloudy the great performer also joined Encore's team!

Dialogues.Speaker: Cloudy
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Baa!

Dialogues.Speaker: Encore
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But not everyone in the Magical Kingdom was very nice...

Dialogues.Speaker: Encore
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: One day, Warrior Encore met Cosmos.

Dialogues.Speaker: Encore
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There you go, Cosmos!

Dialogues.Speaker: "Cosmos"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I used to live in the Magical Kingdom, but I went on a big adventure far away.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Cosmos"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: When I came back, no one knew me, and they wouldn't play with me...

Dialogues.Speaker: "Cosmos"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If you're not Cosmos's friend, I'll just go join the Big Bad Demon and cause trouble!

Options.PlotLineKey: But I want to be your friend.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Cosmos"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Really? That's so nice of you! Sob, sob...

Chapters.Title: Defeat the monsters sent by the Big Bad Demon

Dialogues.Speaker: Encore
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sad little adventurer Cosmos was so moved by these words.

Dialogues.Speaker: Encore
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This special friendship made him join Encore's team.

Dialogues.Speaker: Encore
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: With his brave heart, Cosmos decided to fight the Big Bad Demon and save the Magical Kingdom with Encore!

Dialogues.Speaker: "Cosmos"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Baa!

Chapters.Title: Talk to the strange white cat
Continue your journey to defeat the Big Bad Demon

Dialogues.Speaker: Encore
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Warrior Encore and her friends marched to find the Big Bad Demon.

Dialogues.Speaker: Encore
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The sly Demon sent its monster squad to try to stop them!

Dialogues.Speaker: Encore
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But they were not afraid! Ha, ha! Princess Cloudy and Adventurer Cosmos used all their skills to support Warrior Encore.

Dialogues.Speaker: Encore
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In the end, Encore's super team took care of the monsters! But the Woolies got hurt...

Dialogues.Speaker: Encore
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: To help them feel better, Warrior Encore climbed all the hills and swimmed all the rivers.

Dialogues.Speaker: Encore
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She walked a long way and finally found the magic Golden Sprout!

Dialogues.Speaker: Encore
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She picked it up carefully, and ta-da! She made medicine that healed the Woolies!

Dialogues.Speaker: Encore
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Then, the super team marched on their way to fight the Big Bad Demon.

Chapters.Title: Talk to the strange white cat
Continue your journey to defeat the Big Bad Demon
Rescue the Candlestick Fairy and Gray Ear the Rabbit

Dialogues.Speaker: Encore
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Big Bad Demon sent more monsters to stop Encore.

Dialogues.Speaker: Encore
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But every one of them was defeated by her super team!

Dialogues.Speaker: Encore
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Their amazing feats made lots of people in the Magical Kingdom excited.

Dialogues.Speaker: Encore
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: More and more people wanted to join Encore's team.

Dialogues.Speaker: Encore
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: After careful picking by Warrior Encore, they chose the Candlestick Fairy, who breathes fire.

Dialogues.Speaker: Encore
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Encore also picked Gray Ear the Rabbit, who can slice bread into 100 pieces, and the Stool Spirit, who likes to zoom around on four legs.

Dialogues.Speaker: Encore
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Then came Miss Clover, Uncle Broom, and Grandpa Coal...

Dialogues.Speaker: Encore
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: With more friends joining, Encore's team got bigger and stronger, becoming the super-duper awesome team!

Chapters.Title: Rescue Grandpa Coal and Miss Clover
Talk to the strange white cat
Continue your journey to defeat the Big Bad Demon

Dialogues.Speaker: Encore
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: At last, it was time to fight the Big Bad Demon!

Dialogues.Speaker: Encore
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Gray Ear the Rabbit made yummy bread for everyone so they wouldn't fight on empty stomachs.

Dialogues.Speaker: Encore
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Cloudy put on a show about a brave princess the night before to cheer everyone up.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As the curtain rises, Rover takes {Male=his;Female=her} seat among the audience.

Chapters.Title: Look around and wait for the final battle
Find a place to sit down and watch the final battle

Dialogues.Speaker: Encore
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: On the big battle day, Adventurer Cosmos led the super-duper awesome team to dodge traps and face the Big Bad Demon.

Dialogues.Speaker: Encore
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They battled it out!

Dialogues.Speaker: Encore
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Miss Clover blew wind, Grandpa Coal and the Candlestick Fairy made fire.

Dialogues.Speaker: Encore
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Gray Ear the Rabbit held Uncle Broom and rode the Stool Spirit to charge at the Big Bad Demon!

Dialogues.Speaker: Encore
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Everyone fought bravely!

Dialogues.Speaker: Encore
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Finally, Warrior Encore and the Woolies teamed up for the final blow!

Dialogues.Speaker: Encore
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They defeated the Big Bad Demon! Encore's team stopped his evil plan and brought peace back to the Magical Kingdom.

Chapters.Title: Talk to the Big Bad Demon

Dialogues.Speaker: Big Bad Demon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm... Huh... You beat me today, but there'll always be more demons in this kingdom...

Dialogues.Speaker: Big Bad Demon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Someone's gotta be the Big Bad Demon!

Dialogues.Speaker: Encore
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But why did you have to pick this path?

Dialogues.Speaker: Big Bad Demon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Before I was big and bad, nobody paid any attention to me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Big Bad Demon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now they all fear me!

Dialogues.Speaker: Encore
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But you could be a hero like me!

Dialogues.Speaker: Big Bad Demon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Me? No... I can't.

Dialogues.Speaker: Big Bad Demon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I don't have your bravery. More importantly, I don't have any friends...

Dialogues.Speaker: Encore
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's okay!

Dialogues.Speaker: Encore
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Being a hero isn't just about fighting or going on adventures.

Dialogues.Speaker: Encore
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Uncle Broom keeps the castle spotless. Candlestick Fairy keeps things bright.

Dialogues.Speaker: Encore
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They don't need to be on my team to be heroic warriors. They already are.

Dialogues.Speaker: Encore
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Just do your best at everything and have fun! That's how heroes do lots of cool stuff!

Dialogues.Speaker: Encore
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Don't worry. You can do it too!

Dialogues.Speaker: Encore
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Okay, the Magical Kingdom is now called the Warriors' Kingdom!

Dialogues.Speaker: Encore
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes, with a happy-ever-after ending!

Options.PlotLineKey: Now it's time for a new adventure.

Dialogues.Speaker: Encore
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hooray! I'll tell a new story next time!

Chapters.Title: Find the gateway to leave the Somnoire

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Didn't I just leave the Somnoire... Why am I still here?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Encore's not here. Did she leave already? Let me see if I can find another gateway.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Gatekeeper? Who's the one beside him?

Dialogues.Speaker: Shadow of a Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Excuse me, sir. Is this all real? Are you the god of this realm?

Dialogues.Speaker: Ebony Gatekeeper's Phantom
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...How did you get in?

Dialogues.Speaker: Shadow of a Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I don't know... I was supposed to be at my Grandma's funeral.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shadow of a Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I was watching over her and lost track of time.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shadow of a Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The next moment, I was here... Maybe I fell asleep?

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You believe you've left the Somnoire, only to discover yourself in a new dream. Here, you witness the Ebony Gatekeeper conversing with a young girl.

Chapters.Title: Listen to the Ebony Gatekeeper and Illusia's conversation

Dialogues.Speaker: Ebony Gatekeeper's Phantom
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A part of your consciousness entered Somnoire when you fell asleep.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shadow of a Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Somnoire? What's that? Some kind of Sonoro?

Dialogues.Speaker: Ebony Gatekeeper's Phantom
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No, but you can think of it that way.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shadow of a Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well... just now, I met a girl around my age. She had the same name as Grandma.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shadow of a Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She lived in the same town, had a group of friends, and liked to catch dragonflies in the mountains.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shadow of a Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The only difference is, the temple that should be demolished by monsters was still there, east of the town...

Dialogues.Speaker: Shadow of a Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Grandma used to say that people would pay tribute to their ancestors in that temple every year. The ceremony would be as grand as the Moon-Chasing Festival.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shadow of a Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As much as she loved that town, she never stopped wanting to explore the world outside it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shadow of a Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Um, I heard the Sonoro Sphere can keep memories of people or even a place's history. Is that true?

Dialogues.Speaker: Shadow of a Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What I saw just now, is it real? Is that girl my Grandma?

Dialogues.Speaker: Ebony Gatekeeper's Phantom
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My apologies, but I cannot answer that.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shadow of a Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Can I come here again?

Dialogues.Speaker: Shadow of a Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What happens when I wake up? Will this place and my memory of it disappear?

Dialogues.Speaker: Ebony Gatekeeper's Phantom
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Everything you saw here will be erased, except your memory. That I have no control over.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shadow of a Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's a relief... Thank you, kind sir. That's given me some hope.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shadow of a Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In my memories, Grandma always took care of everyone in the family.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shadow of a Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She raised her children and they left home, then her grandchildren, repeating this cycle her entire life in that old house.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shadow of a Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I always wanted to travel, but I couldn't bear to leave Grandma alone.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shadow of a Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This dream showed me a different side of her. She was once a young girl with dreams... just like me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shadow of a Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She dreamed of traveling, meeting new people, and starting a family.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shadow of a Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now I feel grateful to be part of such a family. And even more grateful to have this side of Grandma live on in my memories.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shadow of a Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I used to think she was old and lonely, but she really glowed with her hopes and dreams.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shadow of a Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you, sir. Thank you for showing me this.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In the dream, the girl encounters her grandmother in her youth, gaining a deeper understanding of her. This heartfelt experience brings her solace, easing the sorrow of her grandmother's passing.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That happened in the past... I was looking at their Illusias.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Gatekeeper showed this to me... What is he trying to tell me?

Dialogues.Speaker: Warning
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Please leave the Somnoire. Data from the last phase will be deleted. Repeat, data from the last phase will be deleted.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's about to collapse... Better leave now.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ebony Gatekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It has been some time, hasn't it {PlayerName}?

Options.PlotLineKey: So, it was you who did this.
Why are you showing me this?

Dialogues.Speaker: Ebony Gatekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I already told you the first time we met: Somnoire is unstable.

Options.PlotLineKey: You didn't say it's because of you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ebony Gatekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It isn't. It's due to Somnoire's innate design.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ebony Gatekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Tell me, what do you think Somnoire was created for?

Dialogues.Speaker: Ebony Gatekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It appears so, but the answer is something more fundamental.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ebony Gatekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Exactly, Dreamwalker...

Dialogues.Speaker: Ebony Gatekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Such a large and complex creation is necessary to save a world torn apart by the Lament.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ebony Gatekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The dreams it stores contain countless possibilities...

Dialogues.Speaker: Ebony Gatekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Millions upon millions of dreams converge in Somnoire... Perhaps within one lies the key to vanquishing the Lament.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ebony Gatekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It may not be the most efficient or practical strategy, but even as a mere spark of hope... I believe it's worth pursuing with all the power I have.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ebony Gatekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They're closely connected to you... But that's not important right now.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ebony Gatekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: One day, you'll find out who they are.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ebony Gatekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Compared to you, who is of immense significance to them, I am just a tool they created to get rid of useless data.

Options.PlotLineKey: Why are you getting rid of it?

Dialogues.Speaker: Ebony Gatekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Every day, people dream, but Somnoire's capacity is finite.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ebony Gatekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Dreams that don't aid in defeating the Lament are deemed worthless.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ebony Gatekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My duty is to erase them, like a heartless executioner.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ebony Gatekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: By this reasoning, the two dreams you just witnessed should also be erased—they offer no solution to save our world.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ebony Gatekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What do you think? Are they useless?

Options.PlotLineKey: They mean a lot to the ones who dreamed them.
Regardless, every dream has its own meaning.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ebony Gatekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Indeed... those dreams are truly precious.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ebony Gatekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They deserved to be remembered.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Ebony Gatekeeper stands before you, revealing that the Somnoire acts as a vessel for storing dreams, and he is on a quest to find a way to confront the Lament. He explains that his role involves clearing the Somnoire by erasing what is deemed "useless dreams." Yet, despite this duty, he struggles with the idea. His conversation with a young girl leads him to the realization that he, too, is just a string of data, and that these so-called "useless dreams" hold the power to inspire and motivate people. Determined to change his course, he resolves to preserve every dream within the Somnoire.

Options.PlotLineKey: What do you want to do?

Dialogues.Speaker: Ebony Gatekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Somnoire has tens of millions of gateways that lead to numerous realms... but it's still too small compared to Solaris.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ebony Gatekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I need more space to store these precious dreams and memories.

Options.PlotLineKey: That's why you're expanding the Somnoire to break into reality itself.
Are you planning to expand Somnoire to encompass all of Solaris?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Those gateways that appeared by the Whining Aix's Mire... It's all because of you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ebony Gatekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes, those places will become part of Somnoire, to merge with the other dreams.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ebony Gatekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Just think of it! They will be forever saved and remembered!

Dialogues.Speaker: Ebony Gatekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Not every dream holds the key to saving the world... Most are personal, trivial, even selfish.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ebony Gatekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But still, they should not be erased.

Options.PlotLineKey: They live on in people's memories.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ebony Gatekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: People may eventually forget them, but Somnoire won't!

Dialogues.Speaker: Ebony Gatekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You saw that girl and how deeply she felt about her dream. It holds significance.

Options.PlotLineKey: That doesn't justify what you're doing.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ebony Gatekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Tell me, have you ever erased another's dreams? Their memories?

Dialogues.Speaker: Warning
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Please leave the Somnoire. Data from the last phase will be deleted. Repeat, data from the last phase will be deleted.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ebony Gatekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: For millennia, I've been doing this tirelessly.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ebony Gatekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Those dreams and I are no different in nature, yet I've done nothing but extinguish them.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ebony Gatekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I don't expect you to understand me. We're not in the same position.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ebony Gatekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Just know that even the great Rover cannot stop me now!

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: To preserve every dream within the Somnoire, the Ebony Gatekeeper resolves to use the real world—the entire Solaris—as a new vessel for dreams. He opens numerous gateways throughout Solaris, allowing dreams to invade and consume reality itself.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This realm is about to collapse...

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I need to wrap this up quickly and get out of here.

Chapters.Title: Talk to the white cat in the carriage

Dialogues.Speaker: Strange White Cat
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's you...

Dialogues.Speaker: Strange White Cat
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That person. He's awake...

Options.PlotLineKey: Why are you talking less this time?

Dialogues.Speaker: Strange White Cat
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Black cat. He's formidable. My power. Limited again. Stop him, Dreamwalker...

Dialogues.Speaker: Strange White Cat
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So tired. Must rest...

Dialogues.Speaker: Strange White Cat
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Meow...

Dialogues.Speaker: Strange White Cat
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Meow—

Dialogues.Speaker: Strange White Cat
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Meow—

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (The cat's weaker than last time. What's worse, the Gatekeeper said the expansion is accelerating...)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (I have to stop it before it's too late...)

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You feel your body grow heavy, as if you're sinking beneath the water, and finally find yourself in an unfamiliar dream.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Red Eagle"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yinlin, do you copy? Got an emergency for you to handle.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Red Eagle"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We need you to infiltrate the Blue Camel and get their latest transaction records.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Red Eagle"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Remember, don't get caught, or they'll destroy the evidence.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yinlin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Infiltration... Hmm, I'll need to suit up right.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yinlin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Gotta sever communications at their camp first. Can't have them calling for backup.

Chapters.Title: Look for a set of Exile clothing

Dialogues.Speaker: Yinlin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This outfit should do the trick.

Chapters.Title: Head to the Blue Camel's camp

Dialogues.Speaker: Yinlin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's their hideout. Time to find a discreet spot to change.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You change to blend in with the other Blue Camel Exiles.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yinlin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This is it... Need to send it back ASAP.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yinlin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Better hang onto this outfit in case I run into the guards.

Dialogues.Speaker: Patroller on Duty
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hey! What's that you're holding?

Dialogues.Speaker: Patroller on Duty
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Open it. We need to check what's inside. We've had reports about Exiles conducting illegal business recently.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yinlin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ("Red Eagle" needs this. I can't let them search the box.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Yinlin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I confess, sir. This is proof of their crimes...

Dialogues.Speaker: Yinlin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I can't stand their dirty deeds anymore, so I'm taking this to the Public Security Bureau myself.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yinlin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If you don't trust me, you can come along.

Dialogues.Speaker: Patroller on Duty
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well... It's good that you want to bring them to justice.

Dialogues.Speaker: Patroller on Duty
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Alright, I'll escort her to the Bureau. The rest of you, resume your duties.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yinlin successfully acquires the transaction records by infiltrating the enemy camp. On her way back, she is apprehended by a Patroller for appearing to be an Exile. Yinlin decides to feign surrender so she can be sent to the Public Security Bureau, where she will deliver the records to "Red Eagle."

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You are struck with a wave of dizziness as the Patroller's voice grows distant...

Dialogues.Speaker: Yinlin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What happened... Huh? Why are they all lying on the ground?

Dialogues.Speaker: Yinlin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No injuries. Looks like they just passed out.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yinlin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They'll wake at any moment. I need to get the evidence back to him.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yinlin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This place... something feels wrong. I need to be on my guard.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Red Eagle"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I've told you before not to come barging in here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yinlin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Something unexpected happened during the mission... This will be safer with you.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Red Eagle"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What's this?

Options.PlotLineKey: The Blue Camel's transaction records. You asked for them.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Red Eagle"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You attacked the Patrollers for this?

Options.PlotLineKey: Something happened to them, but it wasn't my doing.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Red Eagle"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You've been fooled! I never gave you such an order!

Dialogues.Speaker: "Red Eagle"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Can't you spot a fake transmission?

Dialogues.Speaker: "Red Eagle"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You've disappointed me, Yinlin.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yinlin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Was the intel false, or did someone impersonate him when they contacted me?)

Dialogues.Speaker: Yinlin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Blaming me won't make any difference. I need to get to the bottom of this.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yinlin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Give me some time. I'll figure it out.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yinlin presents the records to the "Red Eagle," only to be informed that no such request was ever made. Sensing something amiss, she decides to investigate further.

Chapters.Title: Look for the source of the anomaly

Dialogues.Speaker: Yinlin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Back at the Blue Camel’s camp again? This isn't right...

Chapters.Title: Look for the source of the anomaly

Dialogues.Speaker: Dollmaker
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I've been waiting for you, Yinlin.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yinlin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You! Why are you here?

Dialogues.Speaker: Dollmaker
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You were once part of the Séance Society, until you betrayed me...

Dialogues.Speaker: Dollmaker
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now answer me: who are you?

Dialogues.Speaker: Dollmaker
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ask any Patroller if they recognize you. They would only see you as a defector.

Dialogues.Speaker: Dollmaker
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You are no Patroller, Yinlin. You never will be.

Dialogues.Speaker: Dollmaker
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Haha, is that so? The only one who can prove you are who you say you are has lost faith in you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Dollmaker
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You are no Public Security agent, Yinlin. Your foolishness has ruined everything.

Dialogues.Speaker: Dollmaker
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's right, Yinlin. That's who you are...

Dialogues.Speaker: Dollmaker
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And you don't belong anywhere.

Dialogues.Speaker: Dollmaker
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No one will ever accept you or see your worth. You're nothing!

Dialogues.Speaker: Yinlin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm... nobody...

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yinlin visits the Dollmaker, who tells her that she is neither a Patroller, an undercover investigator, nor even his ally. She has no identity and even a place to stand.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Your thoughts drift back to before this quest began. The lines between memories, dreams, and reality blur together, making you forget that you've experienced all of this before.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Red Eagle"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yinlin, do you copy? Got an emergency for you to handle.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Red Eagle"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We need you to infiltrate the Blue Camel and get their latest transaction records.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Red Eagle"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Remember, don't get caught, or they'll destroy the evidence.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yinlin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What is this? Time's rewound to the start of the mission?

Dialogues.Speaker: Yinlin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's... me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yinlin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No, I have to stop this. How can any of this be possible?

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Just before you can stop yourself, a blade intercepts one of your filaments.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yinlin, calm down!

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No, everything's fine.

Options.PlotLineKey: "Red Eagle" confirmed this mission was a bust.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: He's the mole in the Public Security Bureau.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You did nothing wrong.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No, you knew it all along. Just not in this place.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The mission was a success. You caught the mole and put an end to the Blue Camel's dealings.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As for the Patrollers, you never attacked them.

Options.PlotLineKey: But I made the wrong judgement...
I put my trust in the wrong person.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No, you've always been cautious.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You're just too afraid of making mistakes, that's why you dream these things.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You've only ever had yourself to rely on, but still, you never waver.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Think about that question again. Who are you, really?

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You enter the dream and tell Yinlin not to doubt herself. In reality, she has successfully exposed the "Red Eagle" as a traitor and completed her mission perfectly.

Chapters.Title: Talk to the strange white cat

Dialogues.Speaker: Dollmaker
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You're nothing, Yinlin!

Dialogues.Speaker: Yinlin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Enough talking, Dollmaker. You've lost yourself.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yinlin!

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yinlin!

Dialogues.Speaker: Yinlin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}, you came because you were worried about me?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let's take them down together.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yinlin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hehe, no rush. They'll be leaving soon.

Dialogues.Speaker: Dollmaker
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You betrayed the Patrollers. You betrayed me! Who will ever trust you after this?!

Dialogues.Speaker: Yinlin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I know who I am. I have my own path to walk.

Chapters.Title: Talk to the white cat in the carriage

Dialogues.Speaker: Strange White Cat
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hey! I can talk again!

Options.PlotLineKey: How did you manage to do that?

Dialogues.Speaker: Strange White Cat
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Power grows. Strong enough to fight him.

Dialogues.Speaker: Strange White Cat
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Next time, I will talk even better!

Dialogues.Speaker: Strange White Cat
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Help me... Too much sleep. This is the last time...

Options.PlotLineKey: Cats really do sleep through anything.

Dialogues.Speaker: Strange White Cat
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm no cat, you know...

Dialogues.Speaker: Strange White Cat
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Meow...

Dialogues.Speaker: Strange White Cat
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Meow—

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (From the looks of it, I'm probably the only one who can enter the Somnoire as I please...)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Besides that cat, the only other people here are the ones trapped in their dreams.)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (I will be the one to help them escape.)

Chapters.Title: Complete Dreamscape Odyssey: A Study in Snow

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You feel your body grow heavy, as if you're sinking beneath the water, and finally find yourself in an unfamiliar dream.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Interesting.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It reminds me of the Hongzhen in my memories.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In that year, a peculiar incident occurred.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A parent lost their only child, and despite extensive searches around Mt. Firmament, no trace of the missing boy was discovered.

Dialogues.Speaker: Uneasy Father
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Please, help us find our son...

Options.PlotLineKey: What was he doing before he disappeared?

Dialogues.Speaker: Uneasy Father
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We were having lunch together, just two days ago.

Dialogues.Speaker: Uneasy Father
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Later, I went up the mountain to fetch spring water. When I got back, he was gone...

Options.PlotLineKey: Did your wife see him after you left home?

Dialogues.Speaker: Uneasy Father
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She said Jing was out playing with his friends... but he never came home.

Dialogues.Speaker: Uneasy Father
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I've been worried sick ever since, unable to eat or sleep...  Jing, where are you now...

Dialogues.Speaker: Desperate Mother
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Jing, my poor boy... Please come back home...

Options.PlotLineKey: Did Jing have any close friends?

Dialogues.Speaker: Desperate Mother
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes...

Options.PlotLineKey: Did any of them happen to see him?

Dialogues.Speaker: Desperate Mother
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Jing had been increasingly withdrawn, preferring to stay home. He stopped playing with his friends.

Dialogues.Speaker: Desperate Mother
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But that day, he said he wanted to play with them. It seemed odd, so I asked those kids later, but none of them had seen Jing...

Dialogues.Speaker: Desperate Mother
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ... Oh, how can I go on without my Jing...

Chapters.Title: Talk to the strange white cat

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Beyond the wolves' howls, there's another sound lurking in this storm.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hehe, if you truly are the untamable beasts you claim to be, then why have you let yourself to be so easily at someone's disposal?

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You cautiously inspect the wooden cabinet and discover something strange.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: All of the boy's clothes since his infancy are neatly folded...

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Except for... his pajamas.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm... the board is set, but the final move is yet to be made.

Chapters.Title: Talk to the strange white cat

Dialogues.Speaker: Uneasy Father
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Did you find Jing?

Dialogues.Speaker: Desperate Mother
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Where is he? Please tell me...

Dialogues.Speaker: Uneasy Father
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What?

Dialogues.Speaker: Desperate Mother
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No... my child... Who did this? Why would someone do this?

Options.PlotLineKey: You're the one who killed him.

Dialogues.Speaker: Desperate Mother
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: W-what are you talking about? I don't understand...

Dialogues.Speaker: Uneasy Father
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How did you find out!?

Options.PlotLineKey: I'm afraid you'll never know the answer.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah, a defensive move?

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Not bad, but the game is already finished.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Suddenly, a thunderous sound erupts from the other side.

Chapters.Title: Talk to Rover and the strange white cat

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You don't seem surprised to see me.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How did you know they killed Jing?

Options.PlotLineKey: Mt. Firmament is always covered in snow.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No child would go out in thin pajamas in such freezing conditions.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So you realized it was orchestrated by the Fractsidus...

Options.PlotLineKey: Yes, it was Xinyi who solved this case.
The Fractsidus were lurking in Hongzhen, concealing their true identities.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You know this is a dream, right?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Then why didn't you try to escape?

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: To win a game, you must first play it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Besides... someone who knows they're dreaming is more dangerous, don't you think?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Making yourself part of the game... that's something you'd do.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I need you right now, Changli.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Changli isn't surprised to see you. She has already pieced together the entire story of this case and knows she's trapped in a dream. She reveals that she isn't attempting to escape because she believes she holds the advantage over her enemies, who remain oblivious to their situation.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You don't seem surprised to see me.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How did you know they killed Jing?

Options.PlotLineKey: Mt. Firmament is always covered in snow.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No child would go out in thin pajamas in such freezing conditions.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So you realized it was orchestrated by the Fractsidus...

Options.PlotLineKey: Yes, it was Xinyi who solved this case.
The Fractsidus were lurking in Hongzhen, concealing their true identities.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You know this is a dream, right?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Then why didn't you try to escape?

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: To win a game, you must first play it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Besides... someone who knows they're dreaming is more dangerous, don't you think?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Making yourself part of the game... that's something you'd do.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I need you right now, Changli.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Changli isn't surprised to see you. She has already pieced together the entire story of this case and knows she's trapped in a dream. She reveals that she isn't attempting to escape because she believes she holds the advantage over her enemies, who remain oblivious to their situation.

Chapters.Title: Talk to Rover and the strange white cat
Talk to Rover and the strange white cat

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hehe, he's not the same as the one we faced before.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If they lost back then, they'll lose again today.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Don't worry. While my flames can't destroy this Somnoire, they're more than enough to handle these pests.

Chapters.Title: Talk to the white cat in the carriage

Dialogues.Speaker: Strange White Cat
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Meow! Haha!

Dialogues.Speaker: Strange White Cat
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I can finally talk in full sentences!

Options.PlotLineKey: I prefer how you used to talk.

Dialogues.Speaker: Strange White Cat
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yeah, yeah, try to meow or speak three words yourself. You don't want to know how it feels...

Dialogues.Speaker: Strange White Cat
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Anyway, we're down to our last gateway.

Dialogues.Speaker: Strange White Cat
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Once you rescue the last person from their dream, I can finally balance my control over Somnoire with the Gatekeeper's.

Dialogues.Speaker: Strange White Cat
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's when we can launch our final attack.

Options.PlotLineKey: I'll finish him with one strike.

Dialogues.Speaker: Strange White Cat
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "We" will finish this! Together!

Dialogues.Speaker: Strange White Cat
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Meow! Hey! Don't treat me like a cat!

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Is this real or just another dream?

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hehe... If it's a dream, it better be juicy!

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Huh... {Male=He;Female=She}'s here too?

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Wait for me to catch you, {PlayerName}.

Chapters.Title: Eliminate the enemies standing in your way

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, you wanna play hide and seek?

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The tastiest meal is always the one you've worked hardest to catch.

Chapters.Title: Talk to the strange white cat

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There you are.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Quit the running and come play with me. Let's not waste our precious time.

Chapters.Title: Eliminate the enemies standing in your way

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ugh, what a bother...

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Why does the Black Shores keep dumping these dull missions on me?

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...This doesn't satisfy me at all!

Chapters.Title: Eliminate the enemies standing in your way

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Hello? {Male=He;Female=She} disappeared again.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Boring, boring, boring...

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...I hate boring!

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I live for a good thrill.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But it's so hard to find one that meets my standards.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Some have potential, but they're still too dull.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Only you can really get my heart racing, {PlayerName}.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You swing your final strike at the struggling enemy, but your blade cuts through nothing but air.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...You?

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No... Impossible.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I remember the way you fought—your blade's strong enough to sever the air itself.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Powerful, beautiful, intoxicating...

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah... My head... It hurts. No, that's not you!

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...You?

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No... Impossible.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I remember the way you fought—your blade's strong enough to sever the air itself.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Powerful, beautiful, intoxicating...

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah... My head... It hurts. No, that's not you!

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Is that... Camellya? She needs help.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I need to go to her, quick.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Too slow...

Chapters.Title: Break through the blockages and reach Camellya

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Gotta be faster...

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's... you...

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Hehe, I knew I was right.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That thing couldn't be you. You always... exceed my expectations.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...I know. After all, you're the one I've chosen, my beloved seed.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: While I crave your sweet words, a part of me craves the thrill of hunting you down.

Options.PlotLineKey: We can do this after we get out.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, is that an invitation? You do know how to please me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's... you...

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Hehe, I knew I was right.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That thing couldn't be you. You always... exceed my expectations.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...I know. After all, you're the one I've chosen, my beloved seed.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: While I crave your sweet words, a part of me craves the thrill of hunting you down.

Options.PlotLineKey: We can do this after we get out.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, is that an invitation? You do know how to please me.

Chapters.Title: Talk to the white cat in the carriage

Dialogues.Speaker: Strange White Cat
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You're back, {PlayerName}.

Options.PlotLineKey: Did you regain all your power?

Dialogues.Speaker: Strange White Cat
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes, finally we're here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Strange White Cat
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I and all those you helped in the Somnoire are prepared for the final battle.

Dialogues.Speaker: Strange White Cat
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Once you're set, we'll be ready to face the one responsible for all this.

Dialogues.Speaker: Strange White Cat
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let's repair the Somnoire and shut down his mischief for good!

Dialogues.Speaker: Strange White Cat
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: All set... It's time to fight!

Dialogues.Speaker: Encore
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Here we come, Big Bad Demon!

Dialogues.Speaker: Yinlin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'll give this show a grand finale.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If I can help then, I'll... I'll do my best!

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's time to end this charade.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, to dance alongside you in battle... I can't wait any longer.

Dialogues.Speaker: Strange White Cat
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now, give me your battle cry!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lumi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We promise, we deliver!

Dialogues.Speaker: Strange White Cat
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Not that one. It should be "Let's go save the world again!"

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You have rescued all the Resonators trapped in their dreams, and the white cat has largely regained its clearance. You and your companions are now ready to challenge the Ebony Gatekeeper.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ebony Gatekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Somnoire has tens of millions of gateways that lead to numerous realms... but it's still too small compared to Solaris.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ebony Gatekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I need more space to store these precious dreams and memories.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Just know that even the great Rover cannot stop me now!

Chapters.Title: Defeat the nightmare of the lake

Dialogues.Speaker: Ebony Gatekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You will never understand the meaning of dreams...

Dialogues.Speaker: Encore
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Warrior Encore, ready to attack!

Dialogues.Speaker: Yinlin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Zapstring, it's our turn.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This power... I can feel everyone's support!

Dialogues.Speaker: Strange White Cat
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Meow—

Dialogues.Speaker: Ebony Gatekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No one can save you now. Face me alone, if you dare!

Chapters.Title: Defeat the nightmare of the lake
Defeat the nightmare of the lake

Dialogues.Speaker: Ebony Gatekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Why do you resist? Everything you hold dear can remain in this dream forever!

Chapters.Title: Defeat the nightmare of the lake

Dialogues.Speaker: Ebony Gatekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Only by keeping them here can the dreams live on forever!

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So, this is our opponent?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhezhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}, I-I'll do my best!

Dialogues.Speaker: Strange White Cat
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Meow—

Dialogues.Speaker: Ebony Gatekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No one can save you now. Face me alone, if you dare!

Chapters.Title: Defeat the nightmare of the lake
Defeat the nightmare of the lake

Dialogues.Speaker: Ebony Gatekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You are no longer a Dreamwalker. You are... an obstacle that must be removed!

Chapters.Title: Defeat the nightmare of the lake

Dialogues.Speaker: Lumi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hiya, Lumi's here!

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This fight... better not disappoint me!

Dialogues.Speaker: Strange White Cat
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Meow—

Dialogues.Speaker: Ebony Gatekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No one can save you now. Face me alone, if you dare!

Chapters.Title: Defeat the nightmare of the lake

Dialogues.Speaker: Ebony Gatekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Foolish... You're doing this for nothing!

Chapters.Title: Enter the gateway and confront Ebony Gatekeeper

Dialogues.Speaker: Strange White Cat
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Mission complete. Well done.

Options.PlotLineKey: Has that black cat vanished for good?

Dialogues.Speaker: Strange White Cat
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No, he's just lost some control over the Somnoire. It won't be long before he tries to take it back.

Dialogues.Speaker: Strange White Cat
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Don't worry, I'll keep an eye on him.

Dialogues.Speaker: Strange White Cat
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm... If things get serious, I can call on you again, can't I?

Dialogues.Speaker: Strange White Cat
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: By the way, did you have something you wanted to ask?

Options.PlotLineKey: Why did I experience other people's dreams?

Dialogues.Speaker: Strange White Cat
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Its creation may not be the work of one person. At any rate, I can't say much more about it right now.

Dialogues.Speaker: Strange White Cat
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Because you, or maybe your past self, told me to keep it hush-hush.

Dialogues.Speaker: Strange White Cat
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If I were to tell you why, well... that's already saying too much!

Dialogues.Speaker: Strange White Cat
